definition:
Let $G$ be a ordered group and $F$ its subgroup. We call this subgroup
if every element $f$ of $F$ and every element $g$ of $G$ satisfy
$$f \leqq g \leqq 1 \,\,\,\Rightarrow \,\, g\in F.$$

If an ordered group $G$ has only a finite number of isolated subgroups,
then the number of proper ($\neq G$) isolated subgroups of $G$ is the of
$G$.

Let $G$ be an abelian ordered group with at least 2. The of $G$ equals
one iff there is an order-preserving isomorphism from $G$ onto some
subgroup of the multiplicative group of real numbers.

[9]{} : [*Multiplicative theory of ideals*]{}. Academic Press. New York
(1971).
